snippet: With a new version of the Kindle Fire nearly as large as the iPad that undercuts its price by $200, Amazon made its challenge to Apple a little more serious.
abstract: Amazon, in a challenge to Apple's iPad, announces updates to its line of Kindle e-readers and tablets, including a new version of the Kindle Fire HD nearly as large as the iPad that undercuts its price by $200; company now has seven models ranging from a basic $70 black-and-white screen e-reader to a $600 color tablet.

byline.contributor: Brian X. Chen and David Streitfeld contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: With a new version of the Kindle Fire nearly as large as the iPad that undercuts its price by $200, Amazon made its challenge to Apple a little more serious.
